intro: Verbascum schachdagense, commonly known as the Schachdag mullein, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of soft, velvety hairs. Verbascum schachdagense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in dry conditions.
